name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. James Francis PEARN, Jr., Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Pearn

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. James Francis PEARN, Jr., Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 28th day of December, 2000, upon consideration of the Report and Recommendations of the Disciplinary Board dated October 26, 2000, it is hereby
ORDERED that James Francis Pearn, Jr., be and he is suspended from the Bar of this Commonwealth for a period of three years, and he shall comply with all the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E. It is further ORDERED that respondent shall pay costs to the Disciplinary Board pursuant to Rule 208(g), Pa.R.D.E.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
766 A.2d 326
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. James Francis PEARN, Jr., Respondent.
No. 637 Disciplinary Docket No. 3.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 28, 2000.
